errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that Mirascope requires Python 3.7, which is outdated and contradicts the PyPI badge showing compatibility with modern Python versions.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.7 and will not work with newer versions.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.8 or newer.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope is compatible with Python versions listed on its PyPI page.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope requires Python >= 3.7.'
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.7 and will not work with newer versions.'

errors.error_description: The file path for the 'QuickStart' video thumbnail is incorrect, pointing to a non-existent 'docs/assets' directory and causing the image to not display.
correction_candidates: Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `../assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `./assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
errors.golden_answer: Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `./assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
